result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Brantley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CORRECTED 09-28-2016 TO REFLECT CORRECT CFTS
Concurrent with: 15CF1712

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless sample has been previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Notice of 9/14/15 Hearing to deft - Return to sender - No such number; unable to forward.

ADDRESS INFO for David W Brantley
Current: 1754 Grange Street, Racine, WI 53404 United States  (Effective: 09-15-2015)
Prior: 704 Wadsworth, Waukegan, IL 60087

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance and randomly once per week.   Defendant must attend 7 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  No contact with anyone using or in possession of alcohol.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant David W Brantley in court with attorney Sheila M. Smith.  Defendant David W Brantley in custody.  Maureen Morris Martinez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
